_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: OSHA (29 CFR 1910.101 & 119); CGA pamphlet C-1; NFPA 55
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: pallets, straps, hand trucks, fork lifts
_prev_prog_2.Description: The amount of chlorine stored at this site is being increased to be above the RMP threshold quantity. No manufacturing or transfer of product is carried out at this site. The chlorine is received in 150 pound cylinders and then redistributed in the same cylinders. The facility has standard operating procedures in place for the safe handling of compressed gases. Metal pallets with safety straps or hand trucks are used to move and store the cylinders.  Employees are trained in the proper handling and transport of cylinders.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Airgas National Welders is actively invloved in the management and prevention of risk associated with the storage and use of chlorine at its North Charleston, South Carolina facility. Airgas National Welders actively follows the safety policies and procedures contained in the Airgas Safety Manual.



The Airgas National Welders Risk Management Plan and the Safety Manual involves all operating associates. The plan includes provisions for various levels of training, emergency response, and cylinder handling procedures. Only authorized personnel who have been trained to follow operating, inspection, and maintenance procedures are allowed to handle these chemicals. Any changes to the equipment or procedures shall be documented.



The Risk Management Plan is designed to work in conjunction with the facilitiy's Emergency Plan. The Emergency Plan addresses emergencies arising from fires, chemical releases, uncontrolled releases of flammable gases, bomb threats, civil disorders, and natural disasters such as hurricanes , floods and high winds. All employees are trained on how and to whom to report emergencies and proper evacuation procedures. Certain, qualified employees, have the additional responsibility of responding to an emergency. These emergency coordinators receive training to be familiar with and knowledgeable of emergency response procedures. In the event of any major release of hazardous material, the emergency coordinator and the North Charleston Fire Department are immediately notified, and all Airgas National Welders personnel are evacuated to a predetermined evacuation meeting point. Accidental releases of chemicals are reported and addressed according to the incident investigation procedures found in the Safety and AERO Emergency Response Manuals.



This RMP covers the receipt, storage and distribution of chlorine in 150 lb. cylinders.The chlorine is purchased from an independent vendor, transported to the North Charleston facility via an Airgas National W

elders truck; unloaded and stored at the facility until a customer order is received. The product is then delivered to the customer vai an Airgas National Welders route delivery vehicle. While in transit and during storage, chlorine cylinders are secured to metal pallets with straps to prevent falling. Cylinder valves are protected with valve caps and valve outlets have vapor tight caps to prevent a release should a valve be accidentally opened. All cylinders are serviced and maintained in accordance with DOT and industry guidelines. Airgas National Welders adheres to the recommended chemical specific prevention steps contained in the MSDS for all gases and products stored at each facility. An MSDS for chlorine is located in Section II of the plan.



There have been no  chlorine related accidents, incidents or releases at the North Charleston facility.
